# cycloid_terraform_output (Data Source)

This datasource allows you to fetch a single terraform output from the Cycloid inventory. Look up the [documentation on output](https://docs.cycloid.io/reference/projects/concepts/components#output-from-terraform-output).

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Filter the output with key `some_cool_output` from the env `my-env` in project `my-project`
data "cycloid_terraform_output" "some_cool_output" {
  select_first = true
  filters = [
    {
      attribute = "project_canonical"
      condition = "eq"
      value     = "my-project"
    },
    {
      attribute = "environment_canonical"
      condition = "eq"
      value     = "my-env"
    },
    {
      attribute = "output_key"
      condition = "eq"
      value     = "some_cool_output"
    }
  ]
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `filters` (Attributes List) List of LHS filters to apply to the output. See the docs [here](https://docs.cycloid.io/reference/api/LHS-filters) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--filters))
- `organization` (String) The canonical of the organization where to fetch output, default to the provider's organization
- `select_first` (Boolean) If more than one output is listed, the data will fail, set this attribute to `true` to select the first result.

### Read-Only

- `output` (Attributes) A single terraform output, the output schema will match the result of a single [listInventoryOutput data item from the API](https://docs.cycloid.io/api/#tag/Organization-Inventory/operation/listInventoryOutput). The 'value' and 'type' attributes in the terraform output will be dynamic depending on the terraform output itself. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--output))

<a id="nestedatt--filters"></a>
### Nested Schema for `filters`

Required:

- `attribute` (String) The name of the attribute, you can filter using "output_key", "output_attribute", "project_canonical", "environment_canonical", "component_canonical" or "service_catalog_canonical"
- `condition` (String) The condition to apply, one of "eq", "neq", "gt", "lt", "rlike" or "in".
- `value` (String) The value of the filter


<a id="nestedatt--output"></a>
### Nested Schema for `output`

Read-Only:

- `description` (String) the output description
- `id` (Number) the id of the output
- `key` (String) the key of the output
- `sensitive` (Boolean) is the current attribute sensitive
- `type` (Dynamic) a description of the type
- `value` (Dynamic, Sensitive) the effective value of the output, can be anything a terraform output acepts
